meanings.definition: More inferior or bad in quality or condition than something else.
meanings.sent1: The old car was worset than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was worset than the one that still worked.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk smelled worset than a skunk!
meanings.sent4: The storm made the situation worset, like a dark cloud looming over.
meanings.sent5: The burnt cookies tasted worset than charcoal.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the fruit out in the sun will worset its condition.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to worset the situation, but her words made it worse.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leak without the right tools only worset the problem.
meanings.sent4: His absence worseted her loneliness, like a shadow growing longer.
meanings.sent5: The lack of rain worseted the drought, turning the fields to dust.
